video.title: Functional Programming in Java - Full Course
video.description:
Learn all about Functional Programming in Java with this full tutorial course for beginners. Functional programming will help you reduce and simplify your code.

You will learn the power of Java Functional Interfaces and how they can be used to create powerful statements and design patterns. You will also learn how to write declarative code by combining Functional Interfaces with Streams.

Skills covered:
• Java
• Functional Programming
• Combinator Design Pattern
• Optionals
• Streams

💻 Code: https://github.com/amigoscode/java-functional-programming

🎥 Course from Amingoscode. Subscribe to the Amigoscode YouTube channel: http://bit.ly/2HpF5V8

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00:00) Intro
⌨️ (00:02:54) Quick word before we begin
⌨️ (00:03:36) Bootstrapping Application
⌨️ (00:06:31) Imperative Approach
⌨️ (00:13:30) Declarative Approach
⌨️ (00:19:14) Java Util Function Package
⌨️ (00:22:55) Function
⌨️ (00:36:03) BiFunction
⌨️ (00:43:10) Consumer
⌨️ (00:48:13) BiConsumer
⌨️ (00:52:09) Predicate
⌨️ (01:02:08) Supplier
⌨️ (01:06:55) Let me say something
⌨️ (01:07:29) Intro to Java Streams
⌨️ (01:19:23) More on Java Streams
⌨️ (01:23:52) Java Optionals
⌨️ (01:31:19) Combinator Pattern
⌨️ (01:40:28) Implementing Combinator Pattern
⌨️ (01:55:34) Callbacks Like Javascript
⌨️ (02:05:08) Lambdas
⌨️ (02:11:37) Primitives
⌨️ (02:15:29) Properties of Functional Programming
⌨️ (02:20:25) Let's wrap it up

⭐️ Links ⭐️
🔗 Full course also available here: https://amigoscode.com/courses/java-functional-programming
🔗 Join Closed Facebook Group for discussion and early access videos and courses: http://bit.ly/2FbuIkx
🔗 Follow Amigoscode on Instagram: http://bit.ly/2TSkA9w

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Araz Garayev
topLevelComment.text: Guys I have 0 knowledge of programming, question? do I have to start from Python? but I wanna learn programing for Android App (Java ) programing? do I need start from Java or is it will hard for me ?

replies.author: Rudra P
replies.text:
If you want to do Android programming, java is the easiest path. Try the java for beginners. If starting with java is too difficult, learn C programming first. 
Python is easier to start with but it works differently than java so I would suggest not to start with python.

topLevelComment.author: Hazel Minnie
topLevelComment.text:
please help me!!
i dont understand this question
Question 2 (5 marks)
(a) Establish the inference rule known as absorption which states that from
P ⇒ Q we can infer P⇒ (P and Q).  (2 marks)
(b) Hence show that if P, Q , R and S are propositions, the conclusion S can be inferred from the hypotheses P⇒ S , (P⇒ R)⇒ (Q or S), (P and S) ⇒R, and not Q. (3 marks)
does anyone know how to answer this??

topLevelComment.author: datageekrj
topLevelComment.text:
I have been in love with the content that freecodecamp uploads and that too free of ads. I have consumed a lot of content and now I want to give it back to the community by providing the some valuable content. 

I felt there are lot of programming contents which are related to various programming language but I felt there is a dire need of content that deals with creating web applications which are powered by machine learning. 

Hence, I made this channel for these type of videos. 
Do check out the channel and provide some valuable FEEDBACK. 

Thank you and PEACE.
